title: Integrated Mathematics-Programming Education Design Utilizing IoT-Based Cyber-Physical Interaction

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic programming concepts, proficiency in Python syntax, foundational physics, high school-level geometry (coordinate systems, matrix operations), and vector operation knowledge
context.additional_context: For pre-service/in-service teachers, integrating cyber-physical systems education with mathematics curriculum (emphasizing coordinate transformation, matrix operations, vector analysis, and programming integration).

learning_goals: Acquire browser-based 3D animation programming skills using VPython and implement geometric visualization.
Design and implement an IoT-based cyber-physical interaction system using smartphones (coordinate transformation, rotation matrix application).

Within three weeks, learners develop a physics simulation project (e.g., rigid body motion, collision detection) applying geometry (coordinate transformation, rotation matrices) and vector theory (dot/cross products) and submit deliverables meeting predefined criteria (≥80% functionality, ≥70% code readability).
Analyze educational design improvement plans based on learning data, including mathematical modeling accuracy and algorithm efficiency evaluation.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
